value.0: "So you've come back to your dear friend, Calibast. Just say the word, bring me back, and we'll be off on our merry way." Calibast tosses you a cavalier wink.

You see the ghostly visage of your warrior companion, Calibast, rise above his shattered corpse. The azer stares off into eternity, listening to an inaudible voice, then looks straight into your eyes and grimaces.

"Ach! They finally got me, <FirstName>. Glad I am to have toasted to Mistress Death last night, since I see that you live. I have some inkling of the choice you face, your 'friend' having explained it to me."
"I am sure you would not want to lose my brawn and my cheerful disposition, now would you?"
If a spirit could possibly become paler, Calibast suddenly does. "I understand, <FirstName>, but remember all of the good times we had, when it comes time to choose."
"I should like to think that being friends for so long should mean something. Well, go speak to the others."
"Good to hear it, <lad/lass>. What would your choice be then?"
"I suppose you have a right to take your time choosing. Is there anything else old Calibast can do for you?"

LinkComment.value: spirit fades away, no death scream

value.0: Calibast's soul lets out a deafening screech as it is drawn away from its body and off into eternity.
He nods, showing that he understands, and then fades away into oblivion. You hear a whisper as he goes. "Drink a toast to my soul, in remembrance." Then he is gone.

LinkComment.value: Spirit form disappears, body gets up from the ground, a fully healed, level one fighter.

value.0: "Fear not, my friend, you shall have no regrets!"
"I would be proud to do so! You shall not regret your choice!"
"Well, of course you do, <lad/lass>. Always important to know all the facts, I always say."
"So, fine friend, how are we to proceed?" He wags his fiery eyebrows at you and flashes you his finest, carefree grin.

"Not that I don't feel sorry for the poor lad, but you hardly need Trip's assistance. I can smash my way through most locked doors or containers. And he is such a coward, he's not much good in a fight."
"Not that I don't feel sorry for the poor lad, but with your thief abilities, you hardly need Trip's assistance. And he is such a coward, he's not much good in a fight."
"Of the ladies, Jaboli is rough and easy to get along with. Kaidala is shy, but fearless in a fight. I suspect she still courts death."
"I owe you nothing less. You can trust me to always tell you the truth."
"I fear you must have lost some memories when you were brought back. Let us hope you have not lost too much else! When we met Kaidala she begged us to kill her."
"Her face was a burning scar, like the forest that had been her home. When she saw us coming towards her, she collapsed in tears, begging for a quick, painless end."
"Instead we brought her into our little group of outcasts and helped her rebuild her life, weak as a nymph, but strong in the forces of nature. She made a powerful druid."
"The power of my attacks is formidable, whether it be against a foe or a locked door, an advantage no one should do without."
"Besides my winning personality, I am also resistant to fire and these charming flames are good for something more than just making me pretty, if you know what I mean."
"I am an azer, a dwarf from the plane of fire. I may be surrounded by flames, but I can control them when I want to touch something without burning it."
"Of course, it means I am largely immune to fire based attacks - which can be quite handy. Did you have other questions?"
"Bless my soul and drink to oblivion! We have been together longer than any of the others, <FirstName>! Think of all the fun we have shared."
"We must take life by the hand and let her lead us down the path of her pleasures! Say you'll not forget the joy of our journeys."
"We must grab life by her hips and taste the blessed union of all her pleasures! Say you'll not forget the joy of our journeys."
Calibast's face darkens in anger. "That is cruel of you to say, though I should have expected it. I always thought better of you than you deserved."
"Ha! That is what I love about you, <FirstName>, you're always one step ahead in the fun. Couple that with my prowess in battle and how can you go wrong?"
"Indeed we have, <lad/lass>. Couple that with my prowess in battle and how can you go wrong?"
Calibast's spirit slumps a little. "Ach, I should have tried a different tack with you, my stoic friend. Such is my fierce love of life that I hoped to draw you into it."
"If all the fun and flirtation are not enough to hold us together, then think of the strength of my arms and my ferocity in battle. We have seen much, my friend; let us see more together."
"If the wine, women and song don't bond us together, then think of the strength of my arms and my ferocity in battle. We have been through much, my friend; let us do more together."
"I need to speak to the others before I decide."
"I have made a choice."
"I've changed my mind; I'm not ready to choose."
"Enjoy your time in the underworld; you'll not be leaving it soon!"
"I cannot choose you, old friend."

Comment.value: spirit fades away, no death scream

value.0: "Against my better judgment, I think I will need your skills."
"I would like you to return and assist me."

Comment.value: Spirit form disappears, his real form will meet the PC when he/she leaves the henchman area.

value.0: "I have a few questions for you first."
"That is all my questions."
"Tell me what you think about the others?"
"I have other questions."
"Thanks for your candor."
"What do you mean she still courts death?"
"What skills can you offer me, exactly?"
"Why are you on fire?"
"Tell me why I should choose you."
"I might enjoy watching your smug charm wither in death more."
"Promise me the next three... conquests, and I'll think about it."
"We have had some good times together, Calibast."
"You are a lush and a letch, Calibast. Don't lump me into your failings."
